snippet: Israel’s main labor union began the first general strike in five years on Wednesday in a dispute over treatment of nonunion contract workers.
abstract: Israel’s main labor union begins the first general strike in five years in a dispute over treatment of nonunion contract workers; walkout is expected to cost the economy hundreds of millions of dollars a day; it began after all-night negotiations failed to produce a compromise between the Finance Ministry and the Histadrut labor federation, the umbrella union for hundreds of thousands of public-sector workers.
lead_paragraph: Israel’s main labor union began the first general strike in five years on Wednesday in a dispute over treatment of nonunion contract workers.

headline.seo: Israeli Union Starts a National General Strike
headline.main: Contract Jobs Spur Union To Start Strike Across Israel
headline.print_headline: Contract Jobs Spur Union To Start Strike Across Israel
